Given the endpoint \\( u(X,T) \\), can we specify exactly which interventions were applied (whether \\( h(u) \\), \\( i(u) \\), or both), using only the known values at (X, T)?

The specific details of how \\( e^{Kx} \\) and \\( e^{Mx} \\) interact with the spatial variables and with each other introduces uncertainly and undeterminable factors that prevent definitive backtracking of the interventions used.
